wikipedia_page.main:
Peter Froggatt (born 29 December 1934, Glossop, Derbyshire) is a British talent agent. He attended Hyde Grammar School before training at The Royal Academy of Dramatic Art in London.
He founded one of Great Britain's top theatrical agencies, Plant & Froggatt in 1965. It became Markham & Froggatt, and later  Markham Froggatt and Irwin, and is still in the top ten of talent agents. He is now retired in the Cotswolds.

response: Kitchen was discovered at the Royal Academy of Dramatic Art (RADA) by talent agent Peter Froggatt. In the early 1970s, he appeared in small roles in films such as Unman, Wittering and Zigo (1971) and the Hammer film Dracula A.D. 1972 (1972) before becoming a fixture of British stage and television.
* Peter Froggatt (talent agent) (born 1934), British talent agent
* Peter Froggatt (academic) (born 1928), British doctor and academic
